intro: Angraecopsis ischnopus, commonly known as the white star orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Its blooms appear in late winter to early spring, often after rainfall. Angraecopsis ischnopus is appreciated for its ornamental value and is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
